Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records TAM 565
1 Linear Feet (2 boxes)
2010 1 2 3
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Dan La Botz in 2010; additional materials were donated in 2013. The accession numbers associated with this collectin are 2011.006 and 2013.031.
Historical/Biographical Note
Dan La Botz (1945- ) was the Socialist Party of Ohio's 2010 candidate for the U.S. Senate.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records; TAM 565; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Related Archival Materials
Dan La Botz Papers (TAM 678)
Scope and Contents
This unprocessed collection contains materia relating to La Botz's 2010 Socialist Party campain for Ohio U.S. Senate. The materials include correspondence (with voters, government bodies, the mass media, other (progressive organizations, etc.), a campaign diary, handwritten notes, materials relating to a compliant filed with the FCC (Federal Communications Commission), campaign literature and related printed ephemera, a book-length typescript "A Vision from the Heartland: Socilalism for the 21st Century," and two DVDs containing television appearances and other events.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection, created by Dan La Botz, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
